page.title: 07CHERRY BURTON-6
page.content: Cherry Burton is in the administrative area of the East Yorkshire Borough of Beverley-one of the six predominantly rural boroughs in the County of Humberside;created by the local Government re-organisation in 1974. The village has been designated in the Humberside C.C.Structure Plan as one of the 76 Selected Settlements.These are villages relatively well provided with services and where development and expansion are encouraged within the limits of each village plan.The modern development of C.B.was started in the 60's and was largely completed in the early 80's.Now,in 1985, the village has reached the limit of its present plan,except for a very few sites where it is possible to infill. It is not envisaged that there will be any further expansion in the(CONT.P.8)
